page.title: 14PLUCKLEY GHOSTS 3
page.content: {THE WATERCRESS WOMAN}is believed to be an old gypsy woman who scratched a meagre existence by selling watercress from Pinnock stream. Somehow she spilt gin on to her shawl and a spark fell from her pipe and the shawl caught alight with the result that she burned to death. {THE SCREAMING MAN }is yet another of the Pluckley ghosts. It is impossible to pinpoint the exact spot where this unfortunates life was brought to its sudden and tragic end. He was a worker at the Pluckley brickworks who fell to his untimely death in one of the clay holes on the site. His piercing screams can still be heard around this area.
